com.here.android.mpa.streetlevel

Class StreetLevelOffScreenCapture

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.streetlevel.StreetLevelOffScreenCapture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OffScreenRenderer

    public final class StreetLevelOffScreenCapture
extends java.lang.Object
implements OffScreenRenderer
    StreetLevel derivation of the com.here.android.mpa.common.OffScreenRenderer renderer. This class as allows the user to capture screenshots of a StreetLevel without using an Android View.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.here.android.mpa.common.OffScreenRenderer

        OffScreenRenderer.SurfaceUpdatedListener

        public StreetLevelOffScreenCapture setSize(int width,

        Specified by:
        setSize in interface OffScreenRenderer
        Parameters:
        width - Desired width of the returned bitmap
        height - Desired height of the returned bitmap

      • getScreenCapture

        public void getScreenCapture(OnScreenCaptureListener listener)
        Returns a bitmap of the Street Level Imagery. Bitmap is of size set by StreetLevelOffScreenCapture.setSize(int, int). Call this method only after the rendering thread is started via StreetLevelOffScreenCapture.start(). This method is asynchronous and will invoke a callback once the operation is completed through the ScreenCaptureListener. Note that the rendering thread must be started before this operation.
        Specified by:
        getScreenCapture in interface OffScreenRenderer
        Parameters:
        listener - A ScreenCaptureListener to listen for the callback when screen capture is complete.
        See Also:
        StreetLevelOffScreenCapture.setSize(int, int), StreetLevelOffScreenCapture.start()

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the offscreen renderer. A new PBuffer based surface will be allocated.
        Specified by:
        start in interface OffScreenRenderer

      • start

        public void start(android.view.SurfaceHolder renderTarget,
         OffScreenRenderer.SurfaceUpdatedListener listener)
        Start the offscreen renderer. The renderer will be attached to the supplied Surface argument.
        Specified by:
        start in interface OffScreenRenderer
        Parameters:
        renderTarget - Surface to attach to.
        listener - Callback when the surface has been updated

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the offscreen renderer. All resource allocated will be released.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface OffScreenRenderer

        public void pause()
        Pause the offscreen renderer
